subject: Re: [junit] How to write a Build file which looks at build xml in sub directories
msgSnippet: ... From:  ... the ... I could be mistaken, but how to write a build file seems rather way off topic for this list.
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: <devendra.singh@...>


>
>
> Hi,
>
> I need help to write a Build file which goes to subfolder first, builds
the
> subfolder and then come at root to do the final build.

I could be mistaken, but how to write a build file seems rather way off
topic for this list. Additionally, a lot would depend on what build tools(s)
you are using and the OS of the build machine. It shouldn't be hard at all
to do what you want/need either a batch file (Wintel system) or a shell
script (*nix system), but if you are just getting started and aren't heavily
committed to a particular build system, I would suggest using Ant (
http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/index.html ) and maybe Anthill (
http://www.urbancode.com/projects/anthill/default.jsp ). Both are free (Open
Source) and both are better than more conventional build tools such as
"make".

Good luck,
Lauren
